fields.description:
*Assessment*

When ELB has been deployed across multiple AZs (clusters), but one of the clusters is in a NOTREADY state, both LBs are deployed on the same cluster.  When this happens, if the ELB is deleted, it does not delete the associated autoscaling group.

*Signs*

*Steps*

* Setup Eucalyptus 3.4 cloud with multiple clusters (AZs)
* Set one of the clusters to NOTREADY
* Deploy ELB that spans both clusters
* Delete the ELB

*Workaround*

The only way the autoscaling group can be deleted is by the cloud admin:
{code}

fields.summary: Deleting Load Balancer That Spans Multiple AZs (clusters) Fails to Delete the Associated Autoscaling Group
fields.environment:
*non-HA*
** 1 x CLC/Walrus

comments.body:
Link to sosreports for following components:

* CLC/Walrus - sosreport-CLC-Walrus.8089-20131103164323-6383.tar.xz
* CC-SC (Host with IP ending with .22) - sosreport-CC-SC-22.8089-20131103162728-f035.tar.xz
* CC-SC (Host with IP ending with .185) - sosreport-CC-SC-40.8089-20131103162837-1219.tar.xz

*Additional Information*

To fix the issue regarding the NOTREADY cluster, I had to do the following:

* Shutdown all the Eucalyptus components (starting from the NCs first, then working back up to the CLC)
* Start the CLC/Walrus process
* Start the CC/SC processes on the Exodus cluster (the one that was having issues), wait till both CC and SC showed up as ENABLED in euca-describe-services

[~tjcramer],

I created EUCA-8135 to better understand how ELB should work in this situation (i.e. where one cluster is ENABLED and the other is NOTREADY).

Regarding the request to reproduce using the autoscaling group - does the [comment above|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-8089?focusedCommentId=57704&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-57704] help here? To break it out more - here was the comment I made when both clusters were in the ENABLED state:

we should be able to handle this better within the autoscaling service.
[~sjones] Was the issue resolved in ASG or do you plan to fix it? Broader question is if ELB should expect that deleting ASG would not work in some circumstances?

[~spark], I think this would have been addressed by changes in 4.1. It is generally possible for deletion of an auto scaling group to fail, in particular with the error ScalingActivityInProgress, but this does not occur if instances are terminated prior to deleting the group.
[~sjones] How long the error ScalingActivityInProgress can last? I remember I've put a simple trial-and-error fix in deleting the ASG but that will repeat only a few retry.
[~spark], activities should complete within a few seconds but there are no guarantees.
[~sjones] Ok. I'll make deleting LB not succeed so that users can retry afterwards.
It would be tricky to test the fix because it only happens when ELB fails to delete its autoscaling group. I've done testing with a synthetic failure.

Nice work [~spark] and [~sjones].
